name: Alliteration
definition: Repetition of initial consonant sounds in nearby words for musical effect.
example: Silken satin sheets, slow songs, and soft smiles.

name: Assonance
definition: Repetition of vowel sounds in close proximity to create internal rhyme.
example: These smooth tunes soothe the room.

name: Consonance
definition: Repetition of consonant sounds, typically at the end or middle of words.
example: Soft beats, sweet nights, lost notes.

name: Metaphor
definition: A direct comparison between two things without using 'like' or 'as'.
example: Your love is velvet on my skin.

name: Simile
definition: A comparison using the words 'like' or 'as'.
example: Like vinyl crackle, you take me back.

name: Personification
definition: Giving human qualities to nonhuman things.
example: The city sighs our chorus through the alleyways.

name: Hyperbole
definition: Deliberate and obvious exaggeration used for emphasis or effect.
example: I'd hold the whole sky just to keep your light.

name: Antithesis
definition: Juxtaposition of contrasting ideas in parallel structure.
example: We fall in silence, we rise in song.

name: Chiasmus
definition: Reversal of grammatical structures in successive phrases.
example: I love the rhythm, and the rhythm loves me.

name: Anaphora
definition: Repetition of a word or phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
example: I need your touch, I need your truth, I need your tune.

name: Epistrophe
definition: Repetition of a word or phrase at the end of successive clauses.
example: Sing with me tonight, stay with me tonight, be my only tonight.

name: Pun
definition: A play on words that exploits multiple meanings or similar sounds.
example: You're my sole mate in these soul grooves.

name: Analogy
definition: An extended comparison used to explain or clarify.
example: Loving you is like a needle finding the groove—steady and true.

name: Litotes
definition: An understatement that uses a negative to express a positive.
example: I'm not unhappy when you call at 2 a.m.

name: Anadiplosis
definition: Repetition of the last word of one clause at the beginning of the next.
example: Your touch sparks a fire, a fire that lights the room.

name: Polyptoton
definition: Repetition of words derived from the same root.
example: We love to be in love, loving the love we make.

name: Epanorthosis
definition: Immediate rephrasing or correction to intensify meaning.
example: You're perfect—no, better—you're my favorite verse.
